backcountry_mtn_us package¶

Submodules¶

backcountry_mtn_us.backcountry_mtn_us module¶

backcountry_mtn_us.backcountry_mtn_us.get_closest_park(lat, lng, count)[source]¶

Returns a pandas DataFrame of closest parks by latitude and longitude.

lat : Latitude as an integer (must be within the bounds of -90 and 90) lng : Longitude as an integer (must be within the bounds of -180 and 180) count: How many parks you want returned based on your lat,lng. An integer input.

A pandas DataFrame object that describes distance, elevation, latitude, longitude, park name, timezone, and triplet code (park id).

>> get_closest_park(lat = 50, lng = -120, count = 3)

backcountry_mtn_us.backcountry_mtn_us.get_data(triplet, days)[source]¶

Returns a pandas DataFrame of detailing data of selected park .

triplet : The park id code. In the format of IdNumber:StateAbbreviation:SNTL. A string. days : Number of days (not including today) you want to retrieve data for chosen park

A pandas DataFrame object that describes date, snow water, change in snow water, snow depth, change in snow depth, and temperature.

>> get_data(triplet = ‘1159:WA:SNTL’, days = 2)

backcountry_mtn_us.backcountry_mtn_us.get_data_history(triplet, startdate, enddate)[source]¶

Returns a pandas DataFrame of detailing historical data of selected park .

triplet : The park id code. In the format of IdNumber:StateAbbreviation:SNTL. A string. startdate : Time period you want to start at. YYYY-MM-DD. A string. enddate : Time period you want to end at. YYYY-MM-DD. A string.

A pandas DataFrame object that describes date, snow water, change in snow water, snow depth, change in snow depth, and temperature.

>> get_data_history(triplet = “1125:AZ:SNTL”, startdate = “2013-01-19”, enddate = “2013-01-20”)

backcountry_mtn_us.backcountry_mtn_us.get_state_park(state)[source]¶

Returns a pandas DataFrame of all parks by selected state.

state : The state abbreviation/postal code. For example: California = CA. A string.

A pandas DataFrame object that describes elevation, park name, timezone, triplet/park id, latitude, and longitude.

>> get_state_park(state = “AZ”)

backcountry_mtn_us.backcountry_mtn_us.get_state_stats()[source]¶

Returns a pandas DataFrame that details summary statistics for each state recorded.

None

A pandas DataFrame object that describes max park elevation, average park elevation , and how many parks are in each state.

>> get_state_stats()
